<!-- <UL>
<H2>Java Grande Forum Floating Point Proposals</H2>
<BR></UL></P>
<P><UL>
<LI><H2>Design Goals/Requirements:
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Good Performance on most processors
<LI>High performance supported
<LI>exact reproducibility supported
<LI>access to IEEE floating point features
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>We propose three modes of floating point execution
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>strictfp: Reproducible results as in current default
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>new default: Exploit natural hardware (extended exponent in Intel and fused multiply add FMA)
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>associatefp: Allow conventional compiler optimizations
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Sun will consider some version of this starting with ability to use FMA
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Generic Types, Operator Overloading and lightweight classes are also serious possibilities for thoughtful additions to Java language
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Working with internal Sun staff on drafting modest proposals (as of March 11 meeting in Palo Alto)
</H2>
</UL></P>
<P>  -->
</Body>
</HTML>
